Package com.here.platform.location.core.geospatial.javadsl

Class LineStrings<LS,GC>

java.lang.Object
com.here.platform.location.core.geospatial.javadsl.LineStrings<LS,GC>
public class LineStrings<LS,GC> extends Object
Provides high-level operations on line strings.

    • getInstance

      public static <LS extends LineStringHolder<GC>, GC extends GeoCoordinateHolder> LineStrings<LS,GC> getInstance()
      Returns:
      A LineStrings that provides functions for types implementing LineStringHolder and GeoCoordinateHolder

    • getInstance

      public static <LS, GC> LineStrings<LS,GC> getInstance(LineStringAdapter<LS,GC> lineStringAdapter, GeoCoordinateAdapter<GC> geoCoordinateAdapter)
      Parameters:
      lineStringAdapter - Adapter to extract sequence of points from LS
      Returns:
      A LineStrings tailored for the types adapted by lineStringAdapter and geoCoordinateAdapter

    • pointProjection

      public ElementProjection<LS> pointProjection(GC origin, LS lineString, GeoProjection projection)
      Computes the projection and distance between a point and a line string for which GeoCoordinateOperations and LineStringOperations are defined.

      Parameters:
      origin - The point to be projected in WGS84
      lineString - The Element containing a line string on which to project to (needs to contain at least two points)
      projection - The projection to use (transforms WGS84 into planar coordinates)
      Returns:
      An ElementProjection containing the original Element, the projected point on the line string, and the distance in meters.

    • pointForFraction

      public GeoCoordinate pointForFraction(LS lineString, double fraction)
      Calculates the intermediate point on a great-circle at some fraction of a line string.

      The result is a point on the line string geometry for which the distance from the start of the line string geometry is the given fraction of its full length.

      Parameters:
      lineString - The path geometry
      fraction - The fraction of the line string geometry's full length
      Returns:
      A point implementing the GeoCoordinateOperations trait
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When fraction is not in [0..1]

    • fractionForPoint

      public double fractionForPoint(LS lineString, GC point)
      Calculates the fraction of a line string's full length from its start to some given point.

      The result is in the range [0..1].

      Parameters:
      lineString - The line string or path
      point - The point assumed to be on the line string
      Returns:
      The fraction of the full length from the start of lineString to point
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the given point is actually not on the line string, or if called with less than two points in the line string

    • cut

      public List<LineStringHolder<GeoCoordinate>> cut(LS lineString, List<scala.Tuple2<Double,Double>> ranges)
      Cuts a line string in accordance with passed ranges of fractions. A range consists of start and end fractions. Each cut corresponds to one range so that all points of the line string between start and end fractions are included.

      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when the start or end fraction of a range is not in [0..1] or when the start fraction is greater than the end fraction.
      Note:
      Start and end points will be created for each cut in case there are no points on the line string that correspond to start and end fractions.

      , It is allowed to pass overlapping ranges.

      , If the distance between two points is less than 1cm, they are treated as one point. Because of that, it might happen that a sequence that represents a cut contains only one point instead of two points with the same coordinates.
